body_content.explanation: a small building where sap (= liquid from inside a plant) from trees called sugar maples is made into maple syrup (= a thick, sweet, brown liquid):
examples: The land was full of maple trees, so we built the sugarhouse close to the forest.
A vacuum system sucks air from the plastic tubes that carry the sap from the trees to the sugar house.
I had only been to Quebec once, on a grade 8 trip that involved a visit to a sugar shack.
